summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is identified as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that are constituents of petroleum. The text discusses the presence of BTEX (benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, and xylenes) in various industrial applications and their potential contamination in the environment due to petroleum-related activities. Ethylbenzene's relationship with petroleum is significant as it highlights its role as a component of this complex mixture, which poses environmental risks.
